questions.question: What is the primary purpose of coffee roasting?
choices: To remove moisture from the beans
To change the color of the beans
questions.answer: To develop flavors and aromas

questions.question: Which chemical reaction is responsible for the development of many flavors during coffee roasting?
questions.answer: Maillard reaction

questions.question: What is the 'first crack' in coffee roasting?
choices: The sound of beans breaking during grinding
An audible popping sound when beans expand and cell walls break
The initial heating of the roasting drum
The moment when chaff separates from the beans
questions.answer: An audible popping sound when beans expand and cell walls break

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical roast level?
questions.answer: Extreme

questions.question: What is chaff in coffee roasting?
choices: The silverskin or outer layer that comes off during roasting
The residue left in the roasting machine
questions.answer: The silverskin or outer layer that comes off during roasting

questions.question: What is degassing in the context of coffee roasting?
choices: Removing oxygen from the roasting environment
The release of CO2 from freshly roasted coffee beans
Cooling down the beans after roasting
Removing moisture from green coffee beans
questions.answer: The release of CO2 from freshly roasted coffee beans

questions.question: Which stage of roasting is endothermic?
questions.answer: Early stage

questions.question: What is a roast profile?
choices: The flavor description of a roasted coffee
The planned progression of time and temperature during roasting
The color of the roasted beans
The type of roasting machine used
questions.answer: The planned progression of time and temperature during roasting

questions.question: Which of the following is a traditional coffee roasting method in Timor-Leste?
questions.answer: Pan roasting

questions.question: What typically happens to the acidity of coffee as the roast level darkens?
questions.answer: It decreases

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a variable typically controlled during coffee roasting?
questions.answer: Humidity

questions.question: What is caramelization in coffee roasting?
choices: The breakdown of complex sugars into simpler ones
The formation of oil on the bean surface
The evaporation of water from the beans
questions.answer: The breakdown of complex sugars into simpler ones

questions.question: Which roast level typically has the highest acidity?
questions.answer: Light roast

questions.question: What is the purpose of a cooling tray in coffee roasting?
choices: To quickly stop the roasting process
questions.answer: To quickly stop the roasting process

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical characteristic of dark roast coffee?
questions.answer: Bright, fruity flavors

questions.question: What is the 'second crack' in coffee roasting?
choices: The sound of beans cooling down
A louder, more violent popping occurring in darker roasts
The sound of chaff being removed
questions.answer: A louder, more violent popping occurring in darker roasts

questions.question: Which of the following is a key difference between traditional and modern roasting techniques?
choices: Traditional methods always produce better quality coffee
Modern techniques allow for more precise control of variables
Modern techniques don't require skill or experience
questions.answer: Modern techniques allow for more precise control of variables

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of cupping in relation to coffee roasting?
choices: To evaluate and compare flavors, aromas, and body
To measure the moisture content of beans
To calculate the yield of the roast
questions.answer: To evaluate and compare flavors, aromas, and body

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT typically recorded on a roast log?
questions.answer: Roaster's blood type

questions.question: What is the typical color of light roast coffee beans?
questions.answer: Tan or light brown

questions.question: Which of the following is a benefit of using a drum roaster?
choices: It allows for even heat distribution
It requires no skill to operate
questions.answer: It allows for even heat distribution

questions.question: What is the primary difference between air roasting and drum roasting?
choices: Air roasting uses hot air to roast beans, while drum roasting uses a heated rotating drum
questions.answer: Air roasting uses hot air to roast beans, while drum roasting uses a heated rotating drum

questions.question: Which of the following factors does NOT directly affect the roast profile?
questions.answer: Roaster's mood

questions.question: What is the purpose of a flavor wheel in coffee cupping?
choices: To provide a common language for describing coffee flavors
To calculate the price of the coffee
questions.answer: To provide a common language for describing coffee flavors

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical stage in the coffee roasting process?
questions.answer: Fermentation phase

questions.question: What typically happens to the body of coffee as the roast level darkens?
questions.answer: It becomes heavier

questions.question: Which of the following is a characteristic of Timorese coffee that might influence roasting decisions?
choices: It's typically very low in acidity
It often includes the Timor Hybrid variety
questions.answer: It often includes the Timor Hybrid variety

questions.question: What is the primary purpose of adjusting airflow during coffee roasting?
choices: To control the rate of heat transfer
questions.answer: To control the rate of heat transfer

questions.question: Which of the following is NOT a typical consideration when developing a roast profile for a specific coffee?
choices: Processing method of the green coffee
Zodiac sign of the coffee farmer
questions.answer: Zodiac sign of the coffee farmer

questions.question: What is the primary reason for conducting comparative cuppings of different roast levels?
choices: To determine which roast level is objectively the best
To understand how roast level affects flavor profile
To determine the market price of the coffee
questions.answer: To understand how roast level affects flavor profile
